entry.title: Understanding Axis In Pandas
entry.content:
Basic Concepts

  • axis = 0: Refers to rows, Operations are performed on each column.
  • axis = 1: Refers to columns, Operations are performed on each row.

Examples

entry.title: 006Python-threading__1
entry.content:
In CPython, due to the Global Interpreter Lock, only one thread can execute Python code at once(even though certain performance-oriented libraries might overcome this limitation).

But now,threading is still an appropriate model if you want to run multiple I/O-bound tasks simultaneously.

Pythoné€šè¿‡threadingæ¨¡å—æ¥å®ç°å¤šçº¿ç¨‹ï¼Œå†…éƒ¨æ ¸å¿ƒç±»æ˜¯threading.Thread

å‚è€ƒé“¾æ¥:

å®˜æ–¹æ–‡æ¡£

Runoobå‚è€ƒ

The Thread class represents an activity that is run in a separate thread of control.

There are two ways to specify the activity:

  • by passing a callable object to the constructor;

  • by overriding the run() method in a subclass.

    No other methods (except for the constructor) should be overridden in a subclass.

    In other words, only override the __init__() and run() methods of this class.

Once a thread object is created, its activity must be started by calling the threadâ€™s start() method. This invokes the run() method in a separate thread of control.

Once the threadâ€™s activity is started, the thread is considered â€˜aliveâ€™. It stops being alive when its run() method terminates â€“ either normally, or by raising an unhandled exception.

The is_alive() method tests whether the thread is alive.

Other threads can call a threadâ€™s join() method. This blocks the calling thread until the thread whose join() method is called is terminated.

å¤šçº¿ç¨‹åŸºç¡€

entry.title: 003 - Pythonè¿­ä»£å™¨ä¸ç”Ÿæˆå™¨(iterator & generator)
entry.content:
è¿­ä»£å™¨

An iterable is an object capable of returning its members one at a time. Examples include sequence types (like list, str, and tuple) and some non-sequence types (like dict, file objects, and custom classes with an iter() or getitem() method).

  • Iterable: An object is considered iterable if it implements the iter() method, which returns an iterator.
  • Iterator: An object is considered an iterator if it implements both the iter() and next() methods.

Python supports a concept of iteration over containers.
This is implemented using two distinct methods; these are used to allow user-defined classes to support iteration.

  • iterator.iter() : which return the iterator object itself
  • iterator.next(): which return the next item from the iterator

ç®€å•è¯´:
Python å†…éƒ¨çš„è¿­ä»£å™¨æ˜¯é€šè¿‡å®ç°è¿­ä»£åè®®ï¼ˆå³åŒ…å« iter() å’Œ next() æ–¹æ³•ï¼‰æ¥å·¥ä½œçš„ã€‚

åŒè¿‡ä¸Šè¿°ä»£ç å¯çŸ¥ï¼Œå½“è¿­ä»£å®Œæ‰€æœ‰çš„å…ƒç´ ä¹‹åï¼Œä¼šæŠ›å‡ºStopIteration çš„å¼‚å¸¸ï¼šè¯¦ç»†ä¿¡æ¯å¦‚ä¸‹:

å¯å˜ç±»å‹å’Œä¸å¯å˜ç±»å‹çš„ç‰¹ç‚¹:

Immutable Data Types:

  • Immutability: Cannot be changed after they are created.Any modification to an immutable obj results in the creation of a new obj.
  • Hashable: Can be used as keys in dicts and elements in sets.

Mutable Date Types:

  • Mutability: Can be changed after they are created.(add, remove, etc.)
  • Not Hashable: Cannot be used as keys in dicts or elements in sets

â€œIn Python, an object is considered hashable if it has a hash value that remains constant during its lifetime.â€

è¿™é‡Œåªä»‹ç»å–å•†è¿ç®—ç¬¦å’Œå¤æ•°ï¼Œå…¶ä»–ç•¥

å°†Numberä¸­çš„ä¸€ä¸ªç‰¹æ®Šè¿ç®—ç¬¦æ“ä½œ//(å–å•†) åšå¦‚ä¸‹å±•ç¤º:

å¤æ•°:é€šè¿‡jä½œä¸ºæ•°å­—çš„åç¼€ï¼Œæ¥åˆ›å»ºã€‚

str,tuple å’Œ list,dict,setçš„å…³ç³»

String, Tuple, List, Dictionary, and Set in Python share common characteristics because they all inherit from certain base classes that provide these functionalities. The common base classes include:

  1. Iterable: All these types inherit from the Iterable class, which allows them to be iterated over.
  2. Container: They inherit from the Container class, which allows the use of the in keyword to check for containment.
  3. Sized: They inherit from the Sized class, which provides the len() function to get the number of elements.

Here is a brief overview of the inheritance hierarchy:

  • String (str): Inherits from Sequence, which in turn inherits from Iterable, Container, and Sized.
  • Tuple (tuple): Inherits from Sequence, which in turn inherits from Iterable, Container, and Sized.
  • List (list): Inherits from MutableSequence, which in turn inherits from Sequence, Iterable, Container, and Sized.
  • Dictionary (dict): Inherits from MutableMapping, which in turn inherits from Mapping, Iterable, Container, and Sized.
  • Set (set): Inherits from MutableSet, which in turn inherits from Set, Iterable, Container, and Sized.

entry.title: Shellä¸­çš„ç‰¹æ®Šå‚æ•°
entry.content:
Variable & Description
$0The filename of the current script.
$nThese variables correspond to the arguments with which a script was invoked. Here n is a positive decimal number corresponding to the position of an argument (the first argument is $1, the second argument is $2, and so on).
$#The number of arguments supplied to a script.
$*All the arguments are double quoted. If a script receives two arguments, $* is equivalent to $1 $2.
$@All the arguments are individually double quoted. If a script receives two arguments, $@ is equivalent to $1 $2.
$?The exit status of the last command executed.
$$The process number of the current shell. For shell scripts, this is the process ID under which they are executing.
$!The process number of the last background command.

$0

è¾“å‡ºå½“å‰çš„æ–‡ä»¶å

$n

above functionâ€™s output is

arg1 == a
arg2 == b
arg3 == c
arg4 == d

$#

on behalf of the number of total input args.

$* å’Œ $@

  • åœ¨ Shell è„šæœ¬ä¸­ï¼Œ$*å’Œ$@éƒ½ç”¨äºå¼•ç”¨è„šæœ¬çš„æ‰€æœ‰å‚æ•°ã€‚ä½†å®ƒä»¬åœ¨å¤„ç†å‚æ•°çš„æ–¹å¼ä¸Šæœ‰ç»†å¾®çš„å·®åˆ«ã€‚

  • $@å°†æ¯ä¸ªå‚æ•°è§†ä¸ºç‹¬ç«‹çš„ä¸ªä½“ã€‚å½“è¢«åŒå¼•å·"åŒ…å›´æ—¶ï¼Œ"$@"ä¼šå°†æ¯ä¸ªå‚æ•°ä½œä¸ºä¸€ä¸ªç‹¬ç«‹çš„å­—ç¬¦ä¸²è¿›è¡Œå¤„ç†ï¼Œè¿™åœ¨å¾ˆå¤šæƒ…å†µä¸‹æ›´ç¬¦åˆå®é™…éœ€æ±‚ï¼Œç‰¹åˆ«æ˜¯åœ¨éœ€è¦å¯¹æ¯ä¸ªå‚æ•°è¿›è¡Œå•ç‹¬æ“ä½œæ—¶ã€‚

entry.title: 2024å¹´æ€»ç»“
entry.content:
Time flies faster and faster.The year 2024 is almost exhausting.

In this year, whatâ€™s your achievement? what have you lost? what have you gained? What event can be regarded as a historical sign in your life?

Review 2024, do you remember your mission or plan that was made in 2023? Have you made all of that plan come true?

Now, itâ€™s time to anwser the above questions.

  1. I have gained the ability to develop and control test stations at work. I can use Atlas2, Matchbox, Schooner, and other tools. Now, as for me, I can handle this skill and apply it well in real-world situations. But, I still remember how messy my thoughts were when I first encountered Atlas technology. I totally had no idea about it, have no experience about it, even did not know the main entry point of the program. I felt extreme pressure, but I wanted to adapt to the factory, I wanted to be a suitable person for the company.I know it was an important opportunity for me in my career. So, I read the offical document, asked my fellows for help about Atlas, went to product line as soon as possible for knowing the station config and GH-System, and I positively to participated in various forms of test stations. All of these effort were to enhance my ability. I appreciate all the people who helped me during my challenging phase, especially Near.San, my leader.

  2. I have a basic understanding of Shell, Linux, Python, C, and C++. These fundamental skills are very beneficial to me. And Iâ€™m very clear about my shortcomings and the areas where I need to improve. In the coming years, I not only need to complete my work tasks but also deepen my understanding of these skills. Because I know what I must do, no setback can stop me, and no difficulty can defeat me.

  3. The anticipated house was delivered on time. But, what made me sad is the deep corruption and negligence of the real estate developer and the government. Despite the fact that the developer belongs to the CPC, the quality of the house is very poor. Compared to local standards, the underground garage has significant water leakage, and many cracks have appeared in the walls. The officers from the relevant government department claim that everything meets national standards. As a regular citizen, this is a joke; no one listens to your complaints or pays attention to these issues. Even, some neighbors were detained by the police when homeowners gathered to protest legally. This shows they are not interested in fixing the issues but in silencing those who speak up. Iâ€™m so sorry to hear and see the fact that happened in my country. However, as a traditional and real Chinese person, I still insist that my country has a brilliant future. There must be a person who will address these corrupt officials. We just need to be patient and waitâ€¦

  4. 2024 may be a memorable year for me. What makes me excited is my son attending kindergarten. What makes me sad is also my son attending kindergarten. Hahâ€¦ Iâ€™m happy that my son is starting to learn skills that will be useful in his life. It also means I need to say goodbye to his babyhood and his pampered timesâ€¦Yup, I am learning to give him more freedom, patience, and attention. Never spoil him but guide him to be a self-reliant person with a strong inner core.

In summary, Iâ€™m satisfied with myself in 2024. Love my family, my wife, my son. The events of this year have, on the whole, been satisfactory.

In 2025, maybe Iâ€™ll be sent to the Luxshare office in the USA. If itâ€™s true, it will significantly impact on my life as it will be my first time going abroad. And, Iâ€™ll attend adult college in Suzhou. I aim to keep learning throughout my life and expect a better future. Hope I wonâ€™t be let down in the next 15 years.

Next year, I hope everything will be okay. Each person whom I love will be healthier and happier; Each Person who loves me will also be healthier and happier.

Hello, 2025.

Jun 01 2025,
I had received an admission letter by SuZhou University.

ä½œä¸ºåŠ¨è¯ï¼š

â€œSaneâ€ æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªå½¢å®¹è¯ï¼Œç”¨æ¥æè¿°ä¸€ä¸ªäººæˆ–è¡Œä¸ºçš„ç†æ™ºã€æ¸…é†’ã€æˆ–å…·æœ‰å¸¸è¯†ï¼Œè¡¨ç¤ºå¤´è„‘æ¸…æ¥šã€ç²¾ç¥æ­£å¸¸ã€‚å®ƒé€šå¸¸ç”¨äºä¸â€œç–¯ç‹‚â€ï¼ˆinsaneï¼‰ç›¸å¯¹çš„è¯­å¢ƒä¸­ï¼Œä½†ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥å¹¿æ³›åœ°æŒ‡åˆç†çš„ã€æ˜æ™ºçš„è¡Œä¸ºæˆ–æƒ³æ³•ã€‚

æ€»ç»“

â€œSaneâ€ å¼ºè°ƒç†æ™ºã€ç²¾ç¥å¥åº·æˆ–åˆç†çš„æ€è€ƒã€‚å®ƒä¸ä»…ç”¨äºæè¿°äººçš„ç²¾ç¥çŠ¶æ€ï¼Œä¹Ÿå¸¸ç”¨äºå½¢å®¹æŸäº›è¡Œä¸ºæˆ–å†³å®šçš„ç†æ€§å’Œæ˜æ™ºã€‚

1. éš”ç¦»ã€å­¤ç«‹ï¼ˆç‰©ç†ä¸Šçš„åˆ†ç¦»ï¼‰

å¯ä»¥ç”¨äºåœ°ç†ã€æ”¿æ²»æˆ–æ–‡åŒ–èƒŒæ™¯ï¼ŒæŒ‡å°†ä¸€ä¸ªå›½å®¶æˆ–åœ°åŒºä¸å¤–ç•Œéš”ç»ã€‚

åœ¨ç¼–ç¨‹ã€è®¡ç®—æœºç§‘å­¦æˆ–ç½‘ç»œå®‰å…¨ä¸­ï¼Œå¸¸ç”¨æ¥æè¿°å°†æŸä¸ªè¿›ç¨‹ã€é”™è¯¯ã€æˆ–å¨èƒä¸å…¶ä»–éƒ¨åˆ†åˆ†ç¦»ï¼Œä»¥é¿å…å…¶æ‰©æ•£æˆ–å½±å“ã€‚

  • ä¾‹å¥:

6. åœ¨å¿ƒç†æˆ–æƒ…æ„Ÿé¢†åŸŸçš„éš”ç¦»

å¯ä»¥å½¢å®¹ä¸€ä¸ªäººå°†è‡ªå·±çš„æƒ…æ„Ÿä¸ç°å®æˆ–ä»–äººéš”ç¦»ï¼Œé¿å…æƒ…æ„Ÿä¸Šçš„ä¼¤å®³æˆ–å¹²æ‰°ã€‚

æ€»ç»“

â€œIsolateâ€ å¯ä»¥ç”¨äºä¸åŒæƒ…å¢ƒä¸­ï¼Œè¡¨è¾¾å°†æŸäººæˆ–æŸç‰©ä»æ•´ä½“ä¸­åˆ†å¼€æˆ–éš”ç¦»å‡ºæ¥çš„å«ä¹‰ã€‚å®ƒé€‚ç”¨äºç‰©ç†éš”ç¦»ã€æƒ…æ„Ÿå­¤ç«‹ã€ç§‘å­¦ç ”ç©¶ã€æŠ€æœ¯æ“ä½œç­‰å¤šä¸ªé¢†åŸŸï¼Œæ ¸å¿ƒæ„æ€éƒ½æ˜¯â€œåˆ†ç¦»â€æˆ–â€œéš”ç»â€ã€‚

â€œConsultâ€ æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªåŠ¨è¯ï¼Œè¡¨ç¤ºå‘æŸäººæˆ–æŸäº›æ¥æºå¯»æ±‚å»ºè®®ã€æ„è§æˆ–ä¿¡æ¯ï¼Œé€šå¸¸æ˜¯ä¸ºäº†åšå‡ºå†³ç­–æˆ–è·å–ä¸“ä¸šæ„è§ã€‚å®ƒå¯ä»¥ç”¨äºæ­£å¼å’Œéæ­£å¼åœºåˆï¼Œæ¶µç›–å‘ä¸“å®¶ã€ä¹¦ç±æˆ–å‚è€ƒèµ„æ–™å¯»æ±‚å¸®åŠ©çš„è¿‡ç¨‹ã€‚ä»¥ä¸‹æ˜¯å®ƒçš„ä¸»è¦ç”¨æ³•å’Œä¾‹å¥ï¼š

1. å‘æŸäººå¯»æ±‚å»ºè®®æˆ–æ„è§

è¡¨ç¤ºå‘æŸä¸ªä¸“å®¶æˆ–æœ‰ç»éªŒçš„äººå’¨è¯¢æ„è§ï¼Œé€šå¸¸æ¶‰åŠä¸“ä¸šé¢†åŸŸï¼Œå¦‚åŒ»ç”Ÿã€å¾‹å¸ˆã€é¡¾é—®ç­‰ã€‚

3. å•†é‡ã€è®¨è®º

  • ä¾‹å¥:

    • He consulted his business partners about the new strategy.

4. æ­£å¼æˆ–ä¸“ä¸šçš„å’¨è¯¢æœåŠ¡

åœ¨å•†ä¸šæˆ–ä¸“ä¸šç¯å¢ƒä¸­ï¼Œè¡¨ç¤ºæä¾›æ­£å¼çš„å’¨è¯¢æœåŠ¡ï¼Œé€šå¸¸æ¶‰åŠé¡¾é—®æˆ–å’¨è¯¢å…¬å¸ã€‚

  • ä¾‹å¥:

æ€»ç»“

  • Consult ä¸»è¦ç”¨äºè¡¨ç¤ºå¯»æ±‚å»ºè®®ã€æ„è§æˆ–ä¿¡æ¯ï¼Œå¯ä»¥æ˜¯ä»äººã€ä¹¦ç±ã€æ–‡ä»¶ä¸­è·å–ï¼Œä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥æŒ‡å•†é‡æˆ–è®¨è®ºé—®é¢˜ã€‚

â€œAnalogyâ€ æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªåè¯ï¼Œè¡¨ç¤ºé€šè¿‡æ¯”è¾ƒä¸¤ä¸ªä¸åŒäº‹ç‰©çš„ç›¸ä¼¼ä¹‹å¤„æ¥è§£é‡Šæˆ–è¯´æ˜æŸä¸ªæ¦‚å¿µã€‚åœ¨è¡¨è¾¾å’Œæ¨ç†ä¸­ï¼Œç±»æ¯”èƒ½å¤Ÿå¸®åŠ©äººä»¬ç†è§£å¤æ‚æˆ–æŠ½è±¡çš„äº‹ç‰©ã€‚ä»¥ä¸‹æ˜¯ä¸€äº›å¸¸è§çš„ç”¨æ³•å’Œä¾‹å­ï¼š

1. ç±»æ¯”ï¼šç”¨ç›¸ä¼¼æ€§è§£é‡Š

4. ç§‘å­¦ä¸å“²å­¦ä¸­çš„ç±»æ¯”

å¸¸è§è¡¨è¾¾ï¼š

2. è¡¨ç¤ºç›¸åçš„è§‚ç‚¹

æ€»ç»“ï¼š

  • â€œAs opposed toâ€ ç”¨äºè¡¨è¾¾å¯¹æ¯”æˆ–ç›¸åçš„äº‹ç‰©ï¼Œå¼ºè°ƒä¸¤è€…ä¹‹é—´çš„å·®å¼‚ã€‚å®ƒå¯ä»¥åœ¨æ­£å¼æˆ–éæ­£å¼åœºåˆä¸­ä½¿ç”¨ï¼Œå¸®åŠ©æ¸…æ™°åœ°è¡¨è¾¾å¯¹ç«‹çš„é€‰æ‹©æˆ–è§‚ç‚¹ã€‚

é€šè¿‡åœ¨ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªå¼•å·å‰æ·»åŠ ä¸€ç‚¹ bï¼Œå¯ä»¥æŒ‡å®šå®ƒæ˜¯å­—èŠ‚å­—ç¬¦ä¸²è€Œä¸æ˜¯æ–‡æœ¬å­—ç¬¦ä¸²ã€‚

â€œApparentâ€ ä¸»è¦ç”¨æ¥æè¿°æ˜¾è€Œæ˜“è§æˆ–è¡¨é¢ä¸Šçš„çŠ¶æ€ï¼Œé€‚ç”¨äºæ—¥å¸¸äº¤æµå’Œæ­£å¼åœºåˆã€‚å®ƒå¯ä»¥æš—ç¤ºä¸€ç§è¡¨é¢ç°è±¡å¯èƒ½ä¸å®é™…æƒ…å†µä¸åŒã€‚

entry.title: Python - 00_Setup
entry.content:
æ¥æºï¼šhttps://dabeaz-course.github.io/practical-python/Notes/00_Setup.html

peek at

â€œPeek atâ€ æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªå¸¸è§çš„çŸ­è¯­åŠ¨è¯ï¼Œæ„æ€æ˜¯â€œå·å·çœ‹â€æˆ–â€œå¿«é€Ÿæµè§ˆâ€ã€‚å®ƒé€šå¸¸æŒ‡å¿«é€Ÿæˆ–çŸ­æš‚åœ°çœ‹æŸç‰©ï¼Œé€šå¸¸å¸¦æœ‰ä¸€ç§è¯•å›¾ä¸è¢«å‘ç°æˆ–åªæ˜¯è½»è½»ä¸€ç¥çš„å«ä¹‰ã€‚

ç”¨æ³•åŠä¾‹å¥ï¼š

  1. å·å·çœ‹ (to glance quickly or secretly at something):

    • æŒ‡å¿«é€Ÿåœ°æˆ–ç§˜å¯†åœ°çœ‹ä¸€ä¸‹æŸç‰©ï¼Œé€šå¸¸è¡¨ç¤ºå¹¶ä¸æƒ³å¼•èµ·æ³¨æ„ã€‚
    • ä¾‹å¥: â€œShe peeked at her phone during the meeting.â€ï¼ˆå¥¹åœ¨ä¼šè®®æœŸé—´å·å·çœ‹äº†ä¸€çœ¼æ‰‹æœºã€‚ï¼‰
    • ä¾‹å¥: â€œThe children peeked at the presents before Christmas morning.â€ï¼ˆå­©å­ä»¬åœ¨åœ£è¯èŠ‚æ—©æ™¨å‰å·å·çœ‹äº†ä¸€çœ¼ç¤¼ç‰©ã€‚ï¼‰

  2. å¿«é€Ÿæµè§ˆ (to look briefly at something without much attention):

    • å¯ä»¥è¡¨ç¤ºå¿«é€Ÿåœ°æµè§ˆæŸç‰©ï¼Œä¸æ˜¯ä»”ç»†æ£€æŸ¥æˆ–æ·±å…¥é˜…è¯»ï¼Œè€Œåªæ˜¯ç®€çŸ­åœ°çœ‹ä¸€ä¸‹ã€‚
    • ä¾‹å¥: â€œI just peeked at the report, I havenâ€™t had time to read it fully.â€ï¼ˆæˆ‘åªæ˜¯å¿«é€Ÿæµè§ˆäº†ä¸€ä¸‹æŠ¥å‘Šï¼Œè¿˜æ²¡æ¥å¾—åŠä»”ç»†é˜…è¯»ã€‚ï¼‰
    • ä¾‹å¥: â€œHe peeked at the answers before submitting the test.â€ï¼ˆä»–åœ¨æäº¤è€ƒè¯•å‰å·å·çœ‹äº†ä¸€ä¸‹ç­”æ¡ˆã€‚ï¼‰

å¸¸è§æ­é…ï¼š

  • Peek at something: å·çœ‹æŸç‰©ã€å¿«é€Ÿæµè§ˆã€‚
  • Take a peek at: å£è¯­ä¸­çš„å¸¸è§è¡¨è¾¾ï¼Œæ„æ€æ˜¯å¿«é€Ÿçœ‹ä¸€ä¸‹æŸç‰©ï¼Œå¸¦æœ‰éšæ„ã€éæ­£å¼çš„è¯­æ°”ã€‚
    • ä¾‹å¥: â€œLet me take a peek at your notes.â€ï¼ˆè®©æˆ‘çœ‹ä¸€ä¸‹ä½ çš„ç¬”è®°ã€‚ï¼‰

æ€»ç»“ï¼š

â€œPeek atâ€ ç”¨äºæè¿°å·å·çœ‹æˆ–å¿«é€Ÿæµè§ˆæŸç‰©ï¼Œé€šå¸¸æŒ‡çŸ­æš‚åœ°ã€ä¸€ç¥åœ°çœ‹ä¸€ä¸‹ï¼Œä¸æ˜¯æ·±å…¥æˆ–é•¿æ—¶é—´åœ°è§‚å¯Ÿã€‚

peek

v.å·çœ‹ï¼Œçª¥è§†ï¼›å¾®éœ²å‡ºï¼Œæ¢å‡º

n.ä¸€ç¥ï¼Œå·å·åœ°ä¸€çœ‹ï¼›ï¼ˆè®¡ç®—æœºï¼‰è¯»å–æ•°æ®

Most participants find the material to be quite challenging without peeking at solution code (see below).

å¤§å¤šæ•°å‚ä¸è€…åœ¨ä¸æŸ¥çœ‹è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆä»£ç çš„æƒ…å†µä¸‹éƒ½ä¼šå‘ç°è¿™äº›ææ–™éå¸¸å…·æœ‰æŒ‘æˆ˜æ€§ï¼ˆè§ä¸‹æ–‡ï¼‰ã€‚

incline

/ÉªnËˆklaÉªn/

è¯æ ¹è¯ç¼€ï¼š in-å…¥ + -clin-å€¾,æ–œ + -e

â€œInclineâ€ æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªåŠ¨è¯å’Œåè¯ï¼Œå…·æœ‰â€œå€¾å‘â€ã€â€œå€¾æ–œâ€æˆ–â€œè¶‹å‘â€çš„å«ä¹‰ã€‚å®ƒå¯ä»¥ç”¨äºæè¿°ç‰©ç†ä¸Šçš„å€¾æ–œï¼Œä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥ç”¨äºæè¿°å¿ƒç†æˆ–è¡Œä¸ºä¸Šçš„å€¾å‘ã€‚ä»¥ä¸‹æ˜¯å®ƒçš„å¸¸è§ç”¨æ³•åŠä¾‹å¥ï¼š

1. ä½œä¸ºåŠ¨è¯ (to incline)ï¼š

1.1 å€¾å‘äºæŸäº‹ (to have a tendency toward something):

  • è¡¨ç¤ºæŸäººæˆ–æŸç‰©å€¾å‘äºæŸç§è¡Œä¸ºã€æ€åº¦æˆ–é€‰æ‹©ã€‚
  • ä¾‹å¥: â€œI incline to agree with you on this issue.â€ï¼ˆåœ¨è¿™ä¸ªé—®é¢˜ä¸Šï¼Œæˆ‘å€¾å‘äºåŒæ„ä½ çš„çœ‹æ³•ã€‚ï¼‰
  • ä¾‹å¥: â€œHe inclines to be more cautious when making decisions.â€ï¼ˆä»–åœ¨åšå†³å®šæ—¶æ›´å€¾å‘äºè°¨æ…ã€‚ï¼‰

1.2 ä½¿å€¾å‘ (to influence or persuade someone to have a particular opinion or feeling):

  • è¡¨ç¤ºå½±å“æŸäººï¼Œä½¿å…¶äº§ç”ŸæŸç§æƒ³æ³•æˆ–æ€åº¦ã€‚
  • ä¾‹å¥: â€œHis experiences inclined him to become more empathetic.â€ï¼ˆä»–çš„ç»å†ä½¿ä»–å˜å¾—æ›´åŠ æœ‰åŒç†å¿ƒã€‚ï¼‰

1.3 å€¾æ–œã€åå‘ (to lean or bend in a particular direction):

  • æŒ‡ç‰©ä½“æˆ–äººèº«ä½“ç‰©ç†ä¸Šçš„å€¾æ–œæˆ–å¼¯æ›²ã€‚
  • ä¾‹å¥: â€œThe tree inclines slightly to the left due to the wind.â€ï¼ˆè¿™æ£µæ ‘å› ä¸ºé£çš„å½±å“å‘å·¦ç¨å¾®å€¾æ–œã€‚ï¼‰
  • ä¾‹å¥: â€œShe inclined her head in agreement.â€ï¼ˆå¥¹ç‚¹å¤´è¡¨ç¤ºåŒæ„ã€‚ï¼‰

2. ä½œä¸ºåè¯ (an incline)ï¼š

2.1 æ–œå¡ã€å€¾æ–œ (a slope or a slanted surface):

  • æŒ‡ä¸€ä¸ªåœ°é¢æˆ–è¡¨é¢å‘ä¸Šæˆ–å‘ä¸‹çš„æ–œå¡ã€‚
  • ä¾‹å¥: â€œThe road has a steep incline, so be careful while driving.â€ï¼ˆè¿™æ¡è·¯æœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªé™¡å¡ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥å¼€è½¦æ—¶è¦å°å¿ƒã€‚ï¼‰
  • ä¾‹å¥: â€œThe incline of the hill made it difficult to climb.â€ï¼ˆå±±çš„å¡åº¦è®©æ”€çˆ¬å˜å¾—å›°éš¾ã€‚ï¼‰

å¸¸è§æ­é…ï¼š

  • Incline toward/to something: å€¾å‘äºæŸäº‹ã€‚

    • ä¾‹å¥: â€œShe inclines toward traditional values.â€ï¼ˆå¥¹å€¾å‘äºä¼ ç»Ÿçš„ä»·å€¼è§‚ã€‚ï¼‰

  • Be inclined to do something: å€¾å‘äºåšæŸäº‹ã€‚

    • ä¾‹å¥: â€œIâ€™m inclined to think heâ€™s right.â€ï¼ˆæˆ‘å€¾å‘äºè®¤ä¸ºä»–æ˜¯å¯¹çš„ã€‚ï¼‰

  • On an incline: åœ¨å¡ä¸Šï¼Œå½¢å®¹æŸç‰©å¤„äºå€¾æ–œçš„è¡¨é¢ã€‚

    • ä¾‹å¥: â€œThe house is built on an incline.â€ï¼ˆæˆ¿å­å»ºåœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªæ–œå¡ä¸Šã€‚ï¼‰

æ€»ç»“ï¼š

  • Incline ä½œä¸ºåŠ¨è¯æ—¶ï¼Œå¯ä»¥è¡¨ç¤ºå¿ƒç†ä¸Šçš„å€¾å‘ã€ç‰©ç†ä¸Šçš„å€¾æ–œï¼Œä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥æŒ‡ä½¿æŸäººå€¾å‘äºæŸç§è§‚ç‚¹æˆ–è¡ŒåŠ¨ã€‚
  • Incline ä½œä¸ºåè¯æ—¶ï¼Œé€šå¸¸æŒ‡æ–œå¡æˆ–å€¾æ–œçš„è¡¨é¢ã€‚

  • The shell checks to see whether the file /etc/profile exists.If it exists, the shell reads it. Otherwise, this file is skipped. No error message is displayed.
  • The shell checks to see whether the file .profile exists in your home directory. Your home directory is the directory that you start out in after you log in.If it exists, the shell reads it; otherwise, the shell skips it. No error message is displayed.

File Permission/Access Modes

å‚è€ƒé“¾æ¥

When execute the ls -l cmd, the results as follows

NOTE:

In the ls -l listing example, every file line begins with a d, -, or l.

The first column represents different access modes. And the first column stringâ€™s length is 10.

  • The first three characters (2-4) represent the permissions for the fileâ€™s owner. For example, -rwxr-xrâ€“ represents that the owner has read Â®, write (w) and execute (x) permission.
  • The second group of three characters (5-7) consists of the permissions for the group to which the file belongs. For example, -rwxr-xrâ€“ represents that the group has read Â® and execute (x) permission, but no write permission.
  • The last group of three characters (8-10) represents the permissions for everyone else. For example, -rwxr-xrâ€“ represents that there is read Â® only permission.

ç®€è¨€ä¹‹ï¼Œ

é™¤äº†ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªå­—ç¬¦è¡¨ç¤ºæ–‡ä»¶è¿˜æ˜¯æ–‡ä»¶å¤¹ä¹‹å¤–ï¼Œåç»­å­—ç¬¦åˆ†ä¸ºä¸‰ç»„

  • ç¬¬ä¸€ç»„ï¼š(2-4) è¡¨ç¤º æ–‡ä»¶æ‹¥æœ‰è€…çš„ æƒé™
  • ç¬¬äºŒç»„ï¼š(5-7) è¡¨ç¤º ç»„ çš„æƒé™
  • ç¬¬ä¸‰ç»„ï¼š(8-10)è¡¨ç¤ºæ‰€å…¶ä»–äººçš„æƒé™
Changing Permissions

chmod means change mode.

æœ‰ä¸¤ç§æ–¹å¼è¯¥è¡¨æƒé™æ¨¡å¼

  • The Symbolic Model

    1. chmod o+wx testfile

      o: è¡¨ç¤ºå…¶ä»–ç”¨æˆ·ï¼ˆé™¤äº†æ‰€æœ‰è€…å’Œæ‰€å±ç»„ä¹‹å¤–çš„ç”¨æˆ·ï¼‰

      +: è¡¨ç¤ºå¢åŠ æƒé™

    2. chmod u-x testfile

      uï¼š è¡¨ç¤ºç”¨æˆ·ï¼ˆuserï¼‰

      -ï¼š è¡¨ç¤ºç§»é™¤æƒé™

    3. chmod g=rx testfile

      gï¼š ä»£è¡¨ç¾¤ç»„æƒé™ã€‚

      =ï¼š è¡¨ç¤ºèµ‹äºˆæƒé™ï¼Œè€Œä¸æ˜¯æ·»åŠ æˆ–ç§»é™¤ã€‚

  • The Absolute Mode

    NumberOctal Permission RepresentationRef
    0No permissionâ€”
    1Execute permissionâ€“x
    2Write permission-w-
    3Execute and write permission: 1 (execute) + 2 (write) = 3-wx
    4Read permissionrâ€“
    5Read and execute permission: 4 (read) + 1 (execute) = 5r-x
    6Read and write permission: 4 (read) + 2 (write) = 6rw-
    7All permissions: 4 (read) + 2 (write) + 1 (execute) = 7rwx

    NOTE:

    chmoe ä¸‰ä¸ªæ•°å­— filename

    å…¶ä¸­ä¸‰ä¸ªæ•°å­—ä¸­ ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªè¡¨ç¤º userï¼ˆownerï¼‰ï¼Œç¬¬äºŒä¸ªè¡¨ç¤º group ç¬¬ä¸‰ä¸ªè¡¨ç¤º others

entry.title: lua-Loop(å¾ªç¯)
entry.content:
while

Syntax:

while(condition)
do
statement(s)
end

for

å‚è€ƒé“¾æ¥1

The for statement has two variants(å˜ç§): the numeric for and the generic for.

Numeric for (æ•°å€¼forå¾ªç¯)

å®˜æ–¹æ–‡æ¡£

for var=exp1,exp2,exp3 do
something
end

  • exp1: initial condition
  • exp2: final condition
  • exp3: step
    • this exp is optional,when absent, Lua assumes one as the step value.

Generic for (æ³›å‹forå¾ªç¯)

å®˜æ–¹æ–‡æ¡£

The generic for loop allows you to traverse(éå†) all values returned by an iterator function.

ipairs()

When the traversed value is nil, the for loop will terminate.

pairs()

When the traversed value is nil, the for loop will omit the nil value and continue to the rest.

repeatâ€¦until

Similiar to other programing language.

nested loop

Similiar to other programing language.

entry.title: lua-Operators(è¿ç®—ç¬¦)
entry.content:
Arthmetic Operators

Similiar to other programing languages, there are also + - * / % in Lua. On top of that, lua also has ^ (exponent) operator.

Relational Operators

This section is the same to other programing language.

Note: unequal operator is ~=

Logical Operators

This section has a great distinction from others.

NOTE:

Only nil or false will be recognized as false.

and

Similiar to other language &&

or

Similiar to other language ||

not

Similiar to other language !

Misc Operators

  1. .. concatenation

    Concatenates two strings.

  2. # length

    An unary operator that return the length of the a string or a table.

entry.title: Year-End Summary for 2023
entry.content:
Key words of 2023:

  • Make Grandpa and Grandmaâ€™s dream of the journey to Beijing come true.
  • A termination hit me unexpectedly due to uncontrollable factors.
  • The door toward a new world scenario has been opened by LUX.
  • Make rational plans and proceed step by step.
  • All of my wife and son are doing well and will continue to do well.

The journey to BeiJing

People who were born in the 1940s to the 1960s have profound faith in Chairman Mao; itâ€™s one of the most significant beliefs for them. My grandpa and grandma are among those kind people. Especially for Grandpa, he knows lots of songs from that special period, such as ã€ŠHong Hu Shuiã€‹, ã€ŠShe Hui Zhu Yi Haoã€‹, and many more.

With the time goes by, they get older and older.Each of them is nearly 80 years old. I think no kid will go along with them to start the journey to Beijing, except for my sister and me, even though they have many sons and grandsons. Because they have too much work to do, they are unable to take a trip with the elders.

So, I decided to start the journey on April 5th and end on April 8th. â€¦

I donâ€™t want to write the more detail about the journey. Just need to know that we experienced fond memories and a rewarding time.

I was laid off

I was laid off on August 11th suddenly. Can you imagine that I was still working in that afternoon and got a phone call from my boss hence I lost my job For irresistible factors.
I was laid off suddenly on August 11th. Can you imagine that I was still working in the afternoon when I received a phone call from my boss, resulting in the loss of my job due to uncontrollable factors? (In fact,Our business has been shut down, and my colleaguesâ€™s situation were the same as mine.)

To be honest, I felt turmoil. No job means no income. How can I pay my mortgage? How can I support my family? How can I survive? These are all real-world problems.

So I need a job as soon as possible. I know I was falling into a trap, I know the job provide incomes can not solve the problem in the long term, but i can not stop. I know I fell into a trap. I understand that a job providing income may not solve the problem in the long term, but I canâ€™t stop. The trap is the Rat Race, the biggest problem in my whole life. I have not figured out a strategy to resolve it. Currently, a short-term stable job is necessary for me.

I had started to reorganize my resume and applied to many companies. Due to significant layoffs in the internet industry, only a few companies have granted interview opportunities, but the results were not as expected.

I want to say â€œFUCKâ€.

Join the Lux company

I had been hired after fore rounds of interview. Except for the third roundâ€™s onsite interview, all others were conducted through online interviews.

~~I appreciate with my manager named Near profusely. He had did lots of help for me.~~I appreciate my manager named Near profusely. He has done lots of help for me.(I am deeply grateful to my manager, Near, for his extensive assistance.) It seems to me like a completely new industry In Lux. I have never been exposed to the manufacturing industry.

As a novice in the scope of this field, I need lots of to learn to meet workâ€™s requirementI need to learn a lot to meet the requirements of my work. Such as lua, atlas, python, Macos development skillsThis includes skills in Lua, Atlas, Python, and macOS development. Iâ€™m glad to welcome this challenge, and I believe I can do it well.

Rational Plans

  • This section is imperative to me. Act on it step by step.
  • The plans of 2024 are as follows:
  1. Continue to finish reading the Rich Dad Poor Dad book
  2. Accumulate a vocabulary of 3000 unfamiliar words.Accumulate the number of 3000 unfamiliar words
  3. Read Elon Muskâ€™s book.
  4. Listen to the audio resource of the book.
  5. Master Basic Skills about C,C++,Regex
  6. Master Python and Lua development skills
  • English learning is a long term process.It is your basic skills. I think it is more important than procedural competent. It forms the foundation of your skills, which I believe is more important than procedural competence. Train your english abilities diligently.
  • If I can do the above plans accomplish the plans above, I will give myself the biggest â€œZanâ€! There will be no regret in 2024.
  • Strive! Strive! Strive! Struggle! Struggle! Struggle!

Personal life

I am satsified with my family. Love my wife and son forever

Family is my powerful engine; it provides much motivation for me to move forward. God bless you.

entry.title: lua-luarocksåœ¨Projectä¸­çš„åº”ç”¨
entry.content:
Reference

Install luarocks

mission: use luarocks to manage third libs in lua project.

Guarantee the luarocks have been installed in your mac. if not , using the follow command.

Generally, the libs installed using luarocks will locate at global position. But in real situation, weâ€™d like install lib is each Project locally not in global. But in a real-world scenario, we prefer to install libs locally for each project rather than globally.

Exercise

I will install all packages inside a lua_modules folder in the root of a project, using the --tree option of the LuaRocks CLI. As an example, installing the inspect package.

  1. cd the root of your Project.

  2. excute luarocks install --tree=lua_modules inspect

    tree=lua_modules means the libs will be installed at that folder.

  3. create setup.lua and test.lua files.

    1. we need make configrations for pageage in setup.lua file

    2. test the lib in test.luafile

  4. the demo dir as follows:

If you install libs locally, there is nothing when you excute luarocks list;

But if you install globally, there are the libs you installed before when excute that command.

But if you install globally, the libraries you installed before will be available when executing that command.
